section.p: The procedures in this chapter instruct you to create temporary variables that are used as building blocks, to construct configuration variables accurately. You append the variables to /etc/default/serviced, and then edit the file to move the variables to more appropriate locations.

The most important temporary variables specify the IP address or hostname of each host in the ZooKeeper ensemble. The following table identifies these important variables, the names and values of which must be identical on every cluster host.

row.entry: IP address or hostname of the master host
IP address or hostname of delegate host A
IP address or hostname of delegate host B

section.note: All ensemble hosts should be on the same subnet.
